# Independence Avalon

The Independence Avalon is a German single-place, paraglider that was designed by MichaÃ«l Nesler and produced by Independence Paragliding of Eisenberg, Thuringia. It is now out of production.
Design and development
The Avalon was designed as a beginner glider. The models are each named for their relative size.
Company test pilot Christian Amon was also involved in the development as well as flight testing of the Avalon.
